title: Sr. Strategic Advisor I
content:
We are a team of experts who solve difficult intelligence problems and keep our customers safe. We creatively educate and share the story of how threat intelligence can help every facet of their organization. If that interests you, and you want to have a lot of freedom to find more innovative ways to do this, please apply.
Trusted by governments, commercial enterprises, and educational institutions worldwide, Flashpoint helps organizations protect their most critical assets, infrastructure, and stakeholders from security risks such as cyber threats, ransomware, fraud, physical threats, and more. Leading security practitioners—including physical and corporate security, cyber threat intelligence (CTI), vulnerability management, and vendor risk management teams—rely on the Flashpoint Intelligence Platform, comprising open source (OSINT) and closed intelligence, to proactively identify and mitigate risk and stay ahead of the evolving threat landscape. Learn more at www.flashpoint.io.
We have a role for you if you:

Are an experienced cybersecurity or intelligence practitioner 
Have deep subject matter expertise with Cyber Threat Intelligence CTI)
Sets and is accountable for strategic planning and ROI that directly impacts team and company level initiatives
Drive team-level change by demonstrating EQ and contributing alongside happy, healthy, high performing teams
Have a teachable spirit and work ethic that is motivated by healthy competition and an intrinsic drive to help others proactively combat threats to their organizations
Thrive when engaging with Fortune 500 customers and prospects and customers to evangelize the benefits and outcomes of intelligence solutions as a trusted advisor
Understand the workflows, processes and how to navigate a CRM to report on sales activities and pipeline
Possess a proven ability to manage a project from ideation through to completion
Enjoy the technical and creative aspects of building webinars, threat briefings, conference talks and other elements of thought leadership for the purposes of energizing interest and pipeline
Possess a deep integrity of character to be willing to admit mistakes and learn from them
Are obsessed with monitoring the OSINT and D/DW for what’s new and next, becoming an observant storyteller for others to learn from
Can demo or learn to demo Flashpoint solutions to better articulate ROI, value proposition and story
Love consulting with others to listen, solve complex problems and offer creative solutions

What you will achieve: 

Within 30 days

Cross-train across Flashpoint’s intelligence suite of products and services
Work to understand Flashpoint’s deeper ROI
Lean-in and help out wherever it will add value, including helping to create knowledge transfer materials based on past experience

Within 60 days 

Engage in role-playing scenarios with reps and SAs to get more ‘at-bats’ and practice a refined pitch that is not just a presentation, but a true conversation
Brainstorm 1:1 or 1:many briefing opportunities to generate excitement or interest (e.g. threat briefings, conference talks, vulnerability webinars, etc.) among customers and prospects
Tag-in on customer-facing meetings to shadow and learn our consultative approach

By 90 days

Be customer-facing industry practitioners turned product specialists, ready and willing to grow into areas of the Advisory team that could benefit from your expertise


To be successful in this role, you will need to be:

Articulate about value/brand/integrated story
Able to build and nurture rapport with key contacts at prospective customers
Developing into an Innovations Unit // Entrepreneurial // Consultative team player
Working with a ‘Send me’ attitude and enthusiasm for FP Cross-Sells
Self-starters who once aligned with a sales territory, help to formulate strategic decisions that positively influence pipeline generation and pipeline development within that territory. Measuring activities and impact is second nature, part of proving program efficacy and genuinely finding what works and what doesn’t. 

Base Pay Range: $107,500-$170,000/yr plus commission
Why Flashpoint is a Great Place to Work:

Diversity.  Flashpoint is committed to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of diversity, inclusion, belonging, and equity. We recognize that diversity is key to achieving our vision. We believe that every person and their experiences contribute to building a work environment and products and services that will change the world.
Culture and Belonging.  Our company’s culture isn’t something you join, it’s something you build and shape, and each person's unique backgrounds and experiences contribute to who Flashpoint is and will become.  You will have ample opportunities to connect with coworkers through various communication channels and company-funded virtual events: book clubs, happy hours, committees, DIBE discussion group, Donut mixers, local team member meetups and much more. 
Perks. Flashpoint understands that personal wellness is one of the keys to a happy, healthy and productive work environment.  That’s why we also prioritize health and wellness perks like gym reimbursements, expensed lunches, cool cultural initiatives and inclusive employee events.
Career Growth. Flashpoint is invested in the growth of our team members and understands that frequent, two-way feedback is critical to that growth. We encourage regular one-on-ones with your manager, a regular schedule of performance reviews, learning and development opportunities, and guidance through formalized career paths; whether that be towards being a great manager, being a great individual contributor, or a lateral move to gain breadth of knowledge and experience.
